meanings.definition: The number of sets of chromosomes in a cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: The ploidies of the cell determine its genetic makeup.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ploidies of different species to understand their evolution.
meanings.sent3: The ploidies of the fruit fly were so mixed up, it ended up with rainbow-colored wings!
meanings.sent4: In the garden of genetics, the ploidies are the seeds that hold the secrets of life.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful blocks to explain the concept of ploidies to the students.

meanings.definition: The state of having a particular number of sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The abnormal ploidies in the cell caused genetic disorders.
meanings.sent2: The ploidies of the organism were carefully analyzed in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The ploidies of the potato were so content, they never wanted to divide!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like the ploidies of a rollercoaster, constantly changing.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful mural depicting the different ploidies of nature.
